meanings.definition: a group of alkaloids found in tea leaves
meanings.sent1: The theines in tea leaves give the drink its energy-boosting properties.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the taste of tea, knowing that the theines in it help me stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The theines in tea leaves must be having a party, making everyone feel lively!
meanings.sent4: The theines are like little cheerleaders in tea leaves, cheering on our alertness.
meanings.sent5: The theines dance around in tea leaves, waking up our senses with each sip.

meanings.definition: a substance similar to caffeine, found in tea
meanings.sent1: The theines in tea provide a gentle energy boost, unlike the jitters from coffee.
meanings.sent2: I prefer theines in tea for a milder pick-me-up compared to the strong effects of caffeine.
meanings.sent3: The theines in tea are like the calm cousin of caffeine, keeping us alert without the rush.
meanings.sent4: The theines softly whisper wakefulness to us, unlike the loud shout of caffeine.
meanings.sent5: Theines in tea are like a gentle nudge, nudging us awake slowly and steadily.

meanings.definition: a chemical compound that stimulates the central nervous system
meanings.sent1: The theines in tea work to keep our central nervous system alert and active.
meanings.sent2: Doctors say theines in tea can help stimulate the central nervous system in a natural way.
meanings.sent3: The theines in tea are like little messengers, delivering wake-up calls to our nerves.
meanings.sent4: Theines are the conductors in the orchestra of our central nervous system, keeping everything in tune.
meanings.sent5: Theines are like tiny sparks that ignite our central nervous system, keeping us sharp and focused.
